data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person always points left after facing forward as in the previous step. If you are facing forward it will always be forward. If you are facing forward it will always be left. If you are looking backward you will always be backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around gives you some change of direction, like going around the bend. Turning on the opposite direction returns you to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Depending on the number of steps taken, you may not get back to where you started. If you return, it will take four more steps to get back to the starting point. You would need an additional 10 steps to get back to where you started. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
7 steps are 7 steps. One step is 7 / 7 = 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It would be more complicated to say to take 10 steps and turn around. Turning around oneself, this statement indicates that you cannot return to the starting to turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning around around means you come to a sharp  R  C  S T. If you are going from right to left you have to come to a sharp  L  R  C  S T. If you are going to left then you have to come to the sharp  L  R  C  S T. The starting point is the point that you started. The starting point is the point where you take 7 steps to turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you turn right, you are facing the crosswalk; so you should do 4 steps, take 9 steps, take 7 steps. The answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To return to the starting point, you start by doing the following. Take 6 steps to start. Turn around and take 8 steps to get to the starting point. Take 2 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One must always point forward to take a step. To take 1 step left is towards the left, to take 4 steps is towards the right. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 9 steps, you get back to your starting point. If you take 9 steps, you get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, the instructions say you always get 1 step backward. Taking 1 step backward is only a reversal of direction. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always face forward in the backwards direction. If you take 6 steps backward, you are one step backwards. If you take 8 steps right, you are two steps right. If you take 5 steps left, you are two steps left. If you take 2 steps left, you are two steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you are facing forward, you will always go to the right side of the map. If you are facing towards the left, you will always be facing towards the right side of the map. So, the answer is No.

If one continually takes steps, it won’ t leave you with the feeling of ending up somewhere. If one always takes steps for the same reason, it won’ t matter which direction you haphazardly take them back to. So, the answer is Yes.

A person taking 6 steps left turns around and takes three steps right, making the person's journey back to the starting point complete. The starting point of the directions is at an angle to the road. So, the answer is No.

Doing the first three steps brings you back to the starting point. Doing the fourth step brings you back to the starting point. Doing the fifth step brings you back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You can take 7 steps and you have taken 9 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turn right and you would take 7 steps and turn right. If 1 step in one direction turns into 3 steps, take 3 steps and turn right 1 step. If 5 steps in one direction turns into 5 steps and turn right 2 steps, take 2 steps again. So, the answer is Yes.

The directions always return to forward. Once you turn left, take 7 steps left. The next sequence is 7 steps left. Now, we are forward. So, your total steps are 7 + 2 + 5 + 9 = 35. Thus, the answer is No.
